name: GithubRerunWorkflowJob
description:
Re-run a job in a GitHub workflow.

This tool re-runs a specific job and its dependent jobs within a GitHub workflow run. Use it when you need to restart a job that has failed or requires re-execution. Requires authentication with an access token having `repo` scope or `actions:write` permission for GitHub Apps.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: job_identifier
parameters.description: The unique integer identifier of the job to be re-run. This is required to specify which job in the workflow needs to be restarted.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the job.

parameters.name: enable_debug_logging
parameters.description: Set to true to enable debug logging for the re-run.

value_schema.description: Whether to enable debug logging for the re-run.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: repo

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: job_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the job.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the job.
